squat.name: squat
squat.Goal: Strengthen the large muscles in your legs that help you stand up from a chair, walk, and climb stairs.

Instructions.text: Place a standard height (17-19 inches) chair against the wall.
Stand with your heels about 6 inches in front of the chair and your feet hip distance (or slightly wider) apart.
Lower yourself into a seated position. Make sure to keep equal weight on both feet.
Perform the remaining number of repetitions.

CommonMistakes: DO NOT allow knees past toes.
DO NOT allow knees to dip together.

HeelRaise.name: HeelRaise
HeelRaise.Goal: Strengthen the muscles in your legs that help you walk and climb stairs.
Instructions: Stand close to a wall and place your hands on the wall for balance.
Raise yourself up onto your toes.
Perform the remaining number of repetitions with a full range of motion.
